instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3115: What is 820-3115? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't charge battery. See's it and reports it correctly.
threads.message:
Laptop had significant liquid damage.

Ultrasonic'ed it, replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q5480</TRANSISTOR> (pins burnt off) and she powered back up.

Got a green light, but never see an orange. Tells me the battery percentage accurately and runs off the battery fine, just never charges it.

Detects the AC in, shows the lightening bolt through the battery, but the light never goes orange and the battery never increases.


<TRANSISTOR>Q7055</TRANSISTOR> seems to be unstable.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't charge battery. See's it and reports it correctly.
threads.message:
Just tried with another battery and I get an orange light.

Is it possible to fix these batteries?
This one is brand new.

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3115</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - Won't charge battery. See's it and reports it correctly.
threads.message: Batteries cannot be economically fixed, only if you have dozens and dozens.
